summary: This is Hiccup's Armor from How To Train Your Dragon 2.
descriptionHtml:
[center][b][color=#00ff00][size=6]How To Train Your Dragon 2 HIccup's Armor[/size][/color][/b][size=1]
[/size][color=#ffff00]Release: V1.0[/color][/center][center]Model & Textures: Firehawk7171
Nif & Bodyslide: JRCosta[/center]

[b][color=#00ff00][size=4]Description:[/size][/color][/b]

This is Hiccup's armor from HTTYD2.

[b][color=#00ff00][size=4]Where to Find:[/size][/color]

[/b]The armor is craftable at any forge under the leather category.

[b][color=#ff0000][size=4]Requirements:[/size][/color][/b]

None

[b][color=#ffff00][size=4]Installation:[/size][/color][/b]

Extract the contents of the data folder into your Skyrim directory folder. It should look something like this: 

C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim

Activate the HiccupArmor.esp

[b][color=#ffff00][size=4]Uninstallation:[/size][/color][/b]

Go to the meshes folder (C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim\Data\meshes\armor) and delete the folder \httyd2hiccupsarmor

then,

Go to the textures folder (C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim\Data\textures\armor) and delete the folder \httyd2hiccupsarmor

finally,

Go to the data folder: (C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim\Data) and delete the HiccupArmor.esp

[b][color=#ffff00][size=4]Known Issues & Troubleshooting:[/size][/color][/b]

1. The left shoulder sleeve underneath the pauldron is considerably brighter than everything else. I don't know why this is? All the data I can see in nifscope is identical to the other nif objects.
Troubleshoot: Unknown

2. Textures fail to load.
Troubleshoot 1: Upon first time installation and the textures fail to load, unequip the armor and exit the menu, then re-equip the armor. This should solve that issue.
Troubleshoot 2: Type in "Showracemenu" into the command console, exit menu, works for me everytime. But you should only have to do this once per game save. Meaning if you start a new game, load the armor, and apply this method, every save game you load afterwards should load the textures with no issue.

[b][color=#00ff00][size=4]Recommended Mods:[/size][/color]
[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61335/?]HTTYD2 Astrid Armor[/url]

[b][color=#00ff00][size=4]Special Thanks:[/size][/color][/b]

- Huge thank you goes out to JRCosta for his invaluable advice and aid in getting this armor to work in Skyrim. 
- Thank you to Bethesda for making Skyrim, and making it so awesome.
- Thank you Dreamworks for an awesome story, characters, movies, and series.

[b][color=#00ff00][size=4]Tools:[/size][/color][/b]

- Skyrim
- Skyrim CK
- Autodesk 3DS Max 2014
- Adobe Photoshop CS6
- Nifskope
- TES5Edit
- kgtools
author: Firehawk7171
